author: barnabasbusa
content: <@403707149043105803> would you need prague and praugeEOF be activated at the same time?

author: barnabasbusa
content: I thought we discussed yesterday on the call that we not going to pursue `cancunEOFTime`.

author: _shemnon
content: PragueEOF can be different.  If we are going Cancun->PragueEOF you can just set those two, but besu supports PragueEOF as a distinct fork.

author: _shemnon
content: I thought long term yes, btut short term it was a nice to have?  Either way, CancunEOFTime is cancun+EOF, and would succeed to PragueEOFTime.  With that PR both EOF variants are supported so we can do whatever we need.

author: barnabasbusa
content: would nethermind be able to do this kind of trick too?

author: barnabasbusa
content: Iâ€™m happy to add the cancunEOFTime to our ethereum genesis generator too, as long as we have at least one other EL that will support it.

author: barnabasbusa
content: current version of ethereum package now support pragueEOFTime

author: draganrakita
content: I would just go with `PragueEOF` and not complicate things

author: barnabasbusa
content:
One liner to get up and running with eof 

`kurtosis run github.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package --args-file https://raw.githubusercontent.com/ethpandaops/ethereum-package/main/.github/tests/eof.yaml`

author: marioevz
content:
<@403707149043105803> <@907931206081990666> <@275684146658148352> <@425274498732916736> PR https://github.com/ethereum/execution-spec-tests/pull/631 is now merged, so no need to use `max_stack_height`  anymore (most of the time).

There's also now a `Container.Code` shortcut to create a container with a single code section, which is what we use most of the time I think.
